Description: Black granite lion on a plinth; incised prenomen of Khyan and epithet on the breast.
Curator's comments: Discovery first recorded by Rawlinson in a letter from Baghdad dated 5 November 1852 (BM/Middle East archives/Correspondence 1826-1860, vol. 11: PA-RO, item 4482).

Published: HTBM Part 5: Plate 18 Pharaonen Und Fremde Catalogue (Vienna 1994): No.125. Im Zeichen des Mondes, Munich 1999, p.105 [41]. PM VII, p.396 BM OP 28, p.12 A. Verbovsek, Die sogenannten Hyksosmonumente : eine archäologische Standortbestimmung (Göttinger Orientforschungen. IV. Reihe, Ägypten 2006), 17-18. E. Warmenbol (ed.), Sphinx. Les gardiens de l'Egypte, Brussels 2006, 207-8

K. Ryholt, Title: The political situation in Egypt during the Second Intermediate Period, c. 1800-1550 B.C. CNI publications 1997, p. 384 (no. 8) with bibliography. W. Helck, Historisch-biographische Texte der 2. Zwischenzeit und neue Texte der 18. Dynastie (Kleine ägyptische Texte 1993), p. 55 [no. 74].
Bibliographic references: Smith G 1875a / Assyrian Discoveries; an account of explorations and discoveries on the site of Nineveh, during 1873 and 1874 (pp.420-21)
Hall 1914 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 5. (pl.18)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1994 7 Sep-26 Oct, Austria, Vienna, Museen der Stadt Wien, Pharanen und Fremde 2004 21 Mar-31 Oct, Hamm, Gustav Luebcke Museum, War and Peace in Ancient Egypt 2004-2005 10 Dec-17 Apr, Hamburg, Helms Museum, War and Peace in Ancient Egypt 2005 21 May-11 Sept, Mannheim, Reiss Museum, War and Peace in Ancient Egypt 2016 8 Mar-12 Jun, Cleveland, Cleveland Museum of Art, Pharoah: King of Egypt 2018 7 Jun-16 Sep, Barcelona, La Caixa, Pharaoh: King of Egypt 2018-2019 16 Oct-20 jan, Madrid, La Caixa, Pharaoh: King of Egypt
Acquisition notes: Purchased for the British Museum by George Smith who saw it for sale in Baghdad during the time of his work in Mesopotamia in 1873/74.
